Catherine -

			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Catherine Lawson]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[noblecinds@aol.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[172.141.73.44]]></wp:comment_author_IP>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Best of luck to you!  I recently organized and participated in a weight loss challenge to benefit charity, and all the participants did well.  Each one chose their own method of weight loss, and it was interesting to see that the method was less important than the commitment.  (Well, it seems that way anyway).  The challenge was 2 months long, and during that time, I lost 12 pounds.  Even though the event is over, my eating style changed completely, so I'm still dropping weight (which is good since I have another 20 or so to go).  The best thing about it all is that I feel better.  I don't hurt as much since I'm carrying around less weight, so that makes me very happy.  Good luck and stick with it.  People are rooting for you.]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Improve your Self-Worth in 4 Steps</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/21/improve-your-self-worth-in-4-steps/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Jan 2008 21:28:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/21/improve-your-self-worth-in-4-steps/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you have ever struggled with finding or improving your self-worth, this article titled  "<a href="http://theperennialgarden.blogspot.com/2008/01/appraising-your-home.html" title="Appraising your Home" target="_blank">Appraising your Home</a>" by Zenobia may be just what you need. As you will soon discover, the home she speaks about is not the house you live in, but YOU and everything that makes you who you are. I suggest you grab a cup of tea (or whatever drink you enjoy) and be prepared to be inspired.

<em><a href="http://theperennialgarden.blogspot.com/2008/01/appraising-your-home.html" title="Continue to " target="_blank">Continue to "Appraising your Home"... </a></em>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Weight Loss Challenge - Week 1 Results</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/24/weight-loss-challenge-week-1-results/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Jan 2008 12:00:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/24/weight-loss-challenge-week-1-results/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For those who are visiting for the first time, I started a <a href="http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/19/weight-loss-challenge-for-2008/" title="Weight Loss Challenge for 2008" target="_blank">Weight Loss Challenge</a> on Wednesday, January 16, 2008. My goal is to lose 40 pounds of fat this year, so I decided to start off with aerobic breathing exercises for 1 week. I was especially motivated after reading <a href="http://www.oxygenlift.net/lifelift_testimonials" title="Steffi Power's Testimonial" target="_blank">Steffi Power's</a> amazing testimonial.

I know I said I would post videos with demonstration and such, but this past week has been crazy. I just started a new job and am still adjusting to the new schedule. I haven't had more then 4 hours sleep a night since starting and as I type this I wish I were in bed. *sigh* Please bare with me. In the meantime checkout "<a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0812931416?ie=UTF8&amp;tag=natashaswor04-20&amp;linkCode=xm2&amp;camp=1789&amp;creativeASIN=0812931416" title="Be a Loser by Greer Childers" target="_blank">Be a Loser</a>" but Greer Childers or Rashelle Haines' <a href="http://www.lifelift.net/cgi-bin/affiliates/clickthru.cgi?id=natashapl" title="Lift Lift" target="_blank">Life Lift</a> for more information.

<strong>Results of Week 1:</strong>
<ul>
	<li>Weight:         197 lbs.</li>
	<li>Chest:          42.5"</li>
	<li>Waist:          34.75"</li>
	<li>Hip:            46"</li>
	<li>Left Bicep:     12.25"</li>
	<li>Left Thigh:     27.25?</li>
</ul>
As you can see in comparison to my <a href="http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/19/weight-loss-challenge-for-2008/" title="Beginning stats - Weight Loss Challenge for 2008" target="_blank">beginning stats</a>, the only area where I lost inches was around my waist. I was hoping for more inch lost, but I think this is promising considering I made absolutely no diet change whatsoever. I wonder how many inches I'd lose if in addition to not skipping meals, I made healthier food choices.

I had a tough time finding exact spots for the measurement of my chest, bicep and thighs, so I kept the measurement the same. For this reason, I've decided that in the future, I will measure upper abs, waist, middle abs and hips.

Here are some disclaimers, tips and lessons learned about aerobic breathing:
<h3>Aerobic breathing is NOT for everyone</h3>
<strong> </strong>If you have glaucoma, uncontrollable high blood pressure or are pregnant, find another type of exercise. Part of the breathing requires holding your breath for a few seconds, so you can only imagine the pressure that would cause.
<h3> Do the best you can</h3>
Although it's good to aim for 40 breaths a day, start off doing what you can. If 15 breaths is all you can do, that's all good. Try adding 5 breaths a day until you reach 4o. If you push yourself too hard, you could end up like me - burnt out. I started off hyped up about doing 40 breaths and would double or triple the next day if I didn't meet my goal the day before. The problem with this when first starting is that you can end up not enjoying the process by working too hard. Too much at first can also cause some dizziness or nausea .. almost the way you would feel if you decided to go for an hour run on your first day of jogging.
<h3>Stay hydrated</h3>
After my 1 week trial I now understand why it's important to stay hydrated: you will get very thirsty after doing the aerobic breathing exercises. Apparently, the body is taking in more oxygen, and requires more fluid, much the same way you'd need fluids after a nice jog.
<h3>Get plenty of rest the night before</h3>
If you're like me and do your exercises in the morning, it's important to get plenty of rest the night before.  As mentioned earlier, I haven't had a full night sleep since starting my new job. As a result, I find that I get winded and have a tough time completing my sets. Some have said that doing the breathing exercises energize them , but I get the opposite effect. I get really relaxed after a set, so imagine 5 sets after only a couple of hours of sleep. Can we say "Nappy Time"?
<h3>Stay Motivated</h3>
Ok, this is a to be continued section, because I am still trying to figure this part out. Like I said before, I have burnt myself out a bit, so this morning I decided to give myself a break. I will most likely do my breathing exercises after work, but a break is good if you need it.

For now, I think the best motivator is results. In my case, I tried this for 1 week, made no change to my diet and lost almost an inch around my waist. My pants also fit looser and I feel a tighter in my chest area. Not bad, huh?
<h3>My goals for week 2:</h3>
<ol>
	<li>Get more sleep</li>
	<li>Make healthier food choices</li>
	<li>Increase my water intake</li>
	<li>Make a demo video</li>
</ol>
Till next time.]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_id>129</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Barbara]]></wp:comment_author>

			<wp:comment_author_url>http://bloggingwithoutablog.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[216.228.175.26]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-01-24 20:51:00]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-01-25 01:51:00]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi Natasha,

You're doing great!  Weight gain never happens overnight, and the same holds true for weight loss.

Hydration is very important, as is getting a good nights sleep.  When we aren't rested, we are more apt to make poor food choices, and are not as motivated to exercise. 

Hang in there!

<em>Barbara's last blog post..<a href='http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/bloggingwithoutablog/DWWZ/~3/222147679/' rel="nofollow">Can Feng Shui Improve Your Blog</a></em>]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
		<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>130</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Zenobia]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[theperennialgarden@gmail.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://www.theperennialgarden.blogspot.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[70.255.199.126]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-01-25 00:00:37]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-01-25 05:00:37]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I'm proud of you lady!!  I guess, I'll bite the bullet and join you in this challenge.  I've been talking about toning up and becoming more active long enough.  Let me get my thoughts together on this and we'll talk.  

In the meantime, keep it up.  You are and will be an inspiration to many!  You most definitely have been for me.

<em>Zenobia's last blog post..<a href='http://theperennialgarden.blogspot.com/2008/01/appraising-your-home.html' rel="nofollow">Appraising Your Home</a></em>]]></wp:comment_content>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Weight Loss Challenge Status - Week 2</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/03/weight-loss-challenge-status-week-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Feb 2008 05:14:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/03/weight-loss-challenge-status-week-2/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ok, I have good news and bad news. Good news is, I still intend to lose 40 pounds in 2008. The bad new is, aerobic breathing may not be my ticket to the promise land.

In the past week, I've experienced everything from low grade fever to stiff neck to a slightly elevated blood pressure. I could blame all of these symptoms on the breathing exercises, but I have no way of proving this. So, let's just say that I'm on the path of discovering an exercise techniques I can stick with.

As for the eating, I'm still working on making wiser food choices and eating no less then 2-3 hours before bed. I believe that my food choices have improved in the past couple of weeks, but still need tweaking. Once I come up with a specific plan, I will post it here.]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Grace while Driving</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/31/grace-while-driving/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Feb 2008 03:08:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/31/grace-while-driving/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[
<blockquote><em>Before I continue, I must point out that driving is not one of my favorite activities. I've gotten a lot better about it, to where I currently drive 45 minutes to 1 hour drive each way to get to work. Nonetheless, it is not something I usually look forward to doing.</em></blockquote>
It was a bright and sunny morning, and I was driving to work. I saw that the next light had just turned yellow and it was only a few yards away. I considered slowing down, but on impulse decided to go for it. The light turned red as soon as I reached the stop line, but I kept on driving. When I got half way across the intersection, I noticed 2 cop cars were in the process of making a U-turn. The right thing to have done would have been to slow down and let them go... but my foot had other plans. Before I knew it, I was pushing on the gas and going faster, forcing the cops to stop turning. As soon as I passed the cop cars, I thought to myself, "Oh crap, what have I done?..."

Both cop cars turned into my lane and started following me. My heart was pounding and I kept thinking, "I'm gonna get a ticket, I'm gonna get a ticket, I'm gonna get a ticket..." Then suddenly, for reasons I still don't understand, both cop cars moved to the right lane and went about their business.

Thank God for Grace.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[barbara@bloggingwithoutablog.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[216.228.175.26]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-02-17 04:02:46]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-02-17 09:02:46]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I'm guessing next time, you'll move that foot to the brake pedal, and stop at the yellow light.  

You were lucky...this time.  

Be careful, and drive safe.

<em>Barbara's last blog post..<a href='http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/bloggingwithoutablog/DWWZ/~3/235411927/'>RSS Feed Reader Numbers - A Farce</a></em>]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved><![CDATA[1]]></wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[]]></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Blogging About Daily Life</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/03/blogging-about-daily-life/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Feb 2008 15:48:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/03/blogging-about-daily-life/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I was catching up on some email , when a thought flashed through my mind. I realized how little I share about my daily life on this blog. There is so much going on in my life right now, and I never really considered writing about it.  So, I've decided to crack the door open and allow you a greater glimpse into my world.

At this moment, I am taking a quick break from packing to eat some oatmeal. Me and my brother are moving and have to be out of this apartment by tomorrow. I have to do as much as I can today because in the morning, I go to work. Thank God that my bro and I have opposite schedules. While I'm at work, him and his buddies can finish moving and doing whatever else needs to be done.

As for my job, I just started working as an HTML Developer 3 weeks ago. This is my first time working with a design team. At most of my previous jobs, I was either freelancing or taking on the responsibility of an entire design department. Now, I work with men and women who know as much, if not more then me, which is challenging and cool at the same time.

The 2 most challenging aspects of working on a team is learning to be patient and learning to leave my ego at home. As far as patience goes, I am used to working in environments where I have more control over when things happen and how they happen. Now, I have to learn to wait on my fellow team members to do their jobs... so I am constantly reminding myself of one of my favorite quotes:
<blockquote>"Patience is a tree whose roots are bitter, but its fruits are very sweet." <em>-Anonymous</em></blockquote>
Leaving my ego at home is even tougher. For a long time, I worked in a state of always having to defend my intelligence and skills. At my previous job for example, I often felt like I was hired to meet an affirmative action quota. The worst type of insults, in my opinion, are the subtle ones. The one where your intelligence is often being indirectly questioned. The one where your peers are surprised when you do your job well (noticed I said surprised and not impressed - huge difference). The one where you're hired as a salary employee who is expected to put in more then 40 hours, but treated like a micromanaged hourly employee. Funny thing is that the whole time I worked there, I never saw anyone else but the interns be asked to fill out a form every time they were late. And before you think that I was slacking, 99% of my reasons for being late were a transportation issues or sickness. In addition,  whenever I was late or had to miss a day, I always made up for the time by working through my lunches and doing extra work from home. I guess it wasn't enough.

So as far as egos go, I am realizing that on a team there is no room for it. I have to be willing to take constructive criticism and to learn from others. There is also no need to be on the defensive.  I'm finding  that I have as good of a chance to grow and succeed as anyone else. I am not treated like the town idiot, but instead am considered an equal citizen with a voice. I can get used to this.

Anyhow, I must get back to packing. Thanks for taking a glimpse into my world.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Weekly Updates and Rants</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/11/weekly-updates-and-rants/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Feb 2008 12:26:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/11/weekly-updates-and-rants/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It seems that lately I have only been able to update this blog about once a week. I would love to be able to blog daily like <a href="http://jia-tv.com/" title="Jia-tv" target="_blank">Jia</a>, but I haven't figured out how to work that into my schedule. In addition, what the heck would I write about if I were to post everyday? I guess I could write about my day and what I did, but do you really want to read about things like what I ate for breakfast?

Anyways, me and my brother finally moved into our new place and I spent the whole weekend unpacking and cleaning. I can't even begin to describe how tired I am. I should have gone to bed early last night, but sorta neglected to do laundry during the daytime hours. I was up until almost 2am as a result.. *sigh*

Just before writing this post, I decided to watch some news and heard about this messed up six car collision. The  accident was caused by a woman who was driving with a buddy of hers, while they were smoking crack. She crashed head on into an SUV with a mother and her 2 children. The mother's car ended up flipping upside down.

Now, an accident like this sounds pretty tragic as is.  You would think that it couldn't possibly get any worse, right? Wrong. While the mother and her kids were dangling upside down in a totaled SUV, some neighbors decided that it would be a cool idea to rob her. Yes, you heard right... they reached into the SUV and stole the woman's purse.  What is the world coming to?

A few minutes after hearing about that story,  <a href="http://www1.wsvn.com/news/articles/local/MI76176/" title="Mother of boy held in infant's killing expresses frustration" target="_blank">another one</a> caught my attention.  This one woman is frustrated that the case concerning her 12 years-old son is moving a bit too quick. Her son was put in juvenile detention 5 weeks ago after beating his 17 month-old  cousin to death with a baseball bat. When asked why, he reportedly tells officers that she was bothering him while he was watching cartoons...

OK... um... I'm confused. Where was his mother while this little girl was being beaten to death? Isn't this some form of child neglect?

And people wonder why I don't like to watch the news.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Happy Valentines Day!</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/14/happy-valentines-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Feb 2008 20:21:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/14/happy-valentines-day/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I just wanted to take this time to wish everyone a Happy Valentines Day. Although we should be doing this everyday, may this holiday be a reminder to appreciate yourself and those in your life.

This morning I was sent a link to a cool and free <a href="http://www.ryze.com/posttopic.php?topicid=937011&amp;confid=481" title="Valentines Day Workshop" target="_blank">Valentines Day Workshop</a> offered by Marilyn Jenett of "Feel Free to Prosper". Be sure to check it out and let me know what you learn. I hope you get as much out of it as I have.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Yes We Can - Barack Obama 2008</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/17/yes-we-can-barack-obama-2008/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 17 Feb 2008 16:50:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/17/yes-we-can-barack-obama-2008/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I normally try to steer clear of politics, but I'll let it be known that I support Barack Obama. For the past few weeks, I've observed the debates and have paid close attention to what both Hilary Clinton  and Obama have been saying. My conclusion is that either one would make a great president, however I chose Obama because of the incredible impact that I believe his presidency will have on young African Americans in this country.

Most of my life, I have heard my peers and those younger than me say that there is always going to be a cap to what they can achieve in this country. Truth is, I can't blame them for believing this. If you watch any tv at all, you'll see that the media mainly gives props to young African American who they they think are gifted with awesome athletic abilities or musical talent. Young African American actors also tend to be at the bottom of the totem pole.

So based on these observations, where does that leave the rest of us? I guess we are doomed to a 9-5 where no matter what the paycheck says, we are a slave to our jobs. Since we are a slave to our jobs, we can't achieve anything we want to achieve and might as well give up, right? Not anymore.

Now don't get me wrong, we still need to be responsible and pay our bills. However, we African Americans, especially the Generation X, no longer have the excuse that we can't get anywhere in this country.  We no longer have to look to entertainers who have no clue what it means to be a good example as role models for success. Change is here. Everytime you start to forget how much you can achieve, go to <a href="http://www.google.com" title="Google" target="_blank">Google.com</a> and type Barack Obama.

We wanted change and now we have it. On that note, I would like to leave you with this awesome video that a buddy from work told me about. Enjoy and have a blessed day.
<pre><object height="355" width="425">
<param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/jjXyqcx-mYY&amp;rel=1"></param>
<param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/jjXyqcx-mYY&amp;rel=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" height="355" width="425"></embed></object></pre>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>43</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2008-02-17 11:50:26]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-02-17 16:50:26]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[yes-we-can-barack-obama-2008]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="barack-obama"><![CDATA[Barack Obama]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="candidacy"><![CDATA[candidacy]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="hilary-clinton"><![CDATA[Hilary Clinton]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="personal"><![CDATA[Personal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="politics"><![CDATA[Politics]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="politics"><![CDATA[Politics]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="speech"><![CDATA[speech]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="video"><![CDATA[video]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="videos"><![CDATA[Videos]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="yes-we-can"><![CDATA[Yes We Can]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[ratings_users]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[ratings_score]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>Weight Loss 2008 - Plan B</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/24/weight-loss-2008-plan-b/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 24 Feb 2008 18:50:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/02/24/weight-loss-2008-plan-b/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It has been a while since I posted status of my weighloss efforts and I'm proud to say that I haven't given up. Today is Day #1 of my Plan B. I'm not going to post any details of what I'm doing yet, because I want to see if this is something I can commit to.  All I can say is that it combines a a new weight loss/fitness program I just purchased with a few different programs that I've tried in the past.

I really want this to be a lifestyle change rather than a temporary diet, so I'm taking my time and making adjustments as I go. I'm going to do this for a couple of weeks. Once I see that my mind and body are cooperating with me, I'll tell you all about it. Have a great Sunday. :)]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>In Need of a Makeover</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/02/in-need-of-a-makeover/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 02 Mar 2008 16:27:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/02/in-need-of-a-makeover/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[
<h3>My Site Needs a Makeover</h3>
I'm getting tired of seeing all the gray and white. Sadly, I have no time to work on a new layout. *sigh*
<h3>My Wardrobe Needs a Makeover</h3>
You have no idea.. I recycle the same outfits to work every week. Some days, I look like I'm 30 something going on 80. It's pretty lame. Why don't I go shopping you ask? Because I really suck at it. When I go to the mall, I usually end up spending hours at one store, only to walk out with one outfit that I usually stop wearing after a few weeks. In addition, I don't feel too inspired to buy clothes for the size that I currently wear.
<h3>My Life Needs a Makeover</h3>
At this time, life feels like one vicious cycle after another:

From Monday through Friday, I try to wake up between 5:30am and 6:am to get ready for work. To be honest, I usually don't get out of bed until 6:30am - that's how tired I feel.

I usually leave home between 7:30am and 8:00 am so that I can be at work by 9:00 am. That's right, a 45 minutes to 1 hour commute depending on traffic. It would probably go a lot faster if I would jump on the highway, but that's a whole other post...

I'm supposed to get off work at 6:00pm, but on most days I leave after 6:30pm.

After a 45 minutes to 1 hour drive back, I arrive at the nursing home to chill out with moms.  I have a little routine with her where I comb her hair, exercise her arms and feet, do her mouth care, and help clean her if needed. I've also been watching the debates there while I hang out with her since I haven't yet upgraded my cable at home. Yeah it's a bit ghetto, but whateva. I usually don't leave the nursing home until after 10:00pm.

By the time I get home I am beat. I usually try to hop on my lil iBook to check emails and that's where it all stops. I have fallen asleep in the most interesting positions. So if you've been here before and wondered why I don't post to this blog regularly, this is why.

My weekends are the only time I have to clean, do laundry, run errands, or just rest. Lately I have been real selfish on weekends. Where most singles my age use that time to go party and socialize, I just want to be left alone. Before I know it, it's Sunday night. Repeat.

So what would my ideal life be like you ask?
<ol>
	<li>I would figure out a way to heal my mom and others like her. I would then teach others how to do the same.</li>
	<li>I would work for myself and set my own schedule.</li>
	<li>I would have multiple streams of income that are easily maintained in only a few hours (less then 20) a week. In additions, with these income sources, I would earn many times more then what I am making now.</li>
	<li>All of my debts would be paid in full.</li>
	<li>I would hire an image consultant to help me create a look that is flattering to my figure.</li>
	<li>I would spend more time on improving myself physically, emotionally and spiritually.</li>
	<li>I would start doing Kung Fu again.</li>
	<li>I would start traveling again.</li>
	<li>I would start doing volunteer work again.</li>
</ol>
Interested in helping me achieve any of the ideal scenarios I mentioned above? If so, please leave a comment or send me an email. I am all ears and grateful for any help or advice you offer. Thanks. ;)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[72.79.43.60]]></wp:comment_author_IP>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I am with you on the shopping thing. What works for me is to buy classic items in multiple colors and then mix and match. If I want to look different, I change my hair style. I also try to find small things to cheer me up, like manicures, pedicures, or new lipstick. I know how hard it is to care for a loved one, but please don't forget to love yourself.

<em>beeker's last blog post..<a href='http://www.beekerswords.com/americas-financial-future'>America’s Financial Future</a></em>]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[hi natasha. i also want to change my own template. gettin sick of it. i also have the same problem when shopping for clothes. what i do is watch tv or look at magazines and see whats new and what flatters my figure then i hit the mall and look specifically for the style i chose. 

as for your wishlist, its a good thing you've written it down the first step is knowing what u want. what i'd do is take small doable steps on each item then follow it up with another. you might wanna read my latest post. i think its related. neway, gudluck with everything. i hope this helps =)

			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Natasha]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[webqueen@natashasworld.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[75.74.105.107]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-03-09 07:25:32]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-03-09 12:25:32]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi y'all, thanks for your comments:

Monique and Michael - there are many cool templates out there, but I would love for my site not to be cookie cutter or like someone else's. So short of hiring someone (which  I'd like to avoid, if possible) I may need to come up with a layout myself or totally customize an already made template to where it looks totally unique. Both option take time, but I will figure something out.

Michael - I keep hearing that a lot, about how uncommon it is for people to care for their sick or elderly parent(s). I figure everyone has their reasons for what they do or don't do. I've known many people whose parent were either emotionally, verbally or physically abusive, if not all the the above. I wish I could say that I'm the type of person that would have cared for my mom if she treated me badly growing up, but I don't know that. All I know is that neither of us was perfect and she did the best she could to raise me and my siblings as a single mother. I now get a chance to serve her and return the favor.

Beeker - Thanks for the great tips. I've been needing a manicure and pedicure, so maybe I'll start there.]]></wp:comment_content>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>A Detox, the Ego and a New Earth</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/11/a-detox-the-ego-and-a-new-earth/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 11 Mar 2008 18:27:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/11/a-detox-the-ego-and-a-new-earth/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ I know that as a woman I should embrace the natural cycles that my body goes through, but I hate menstrual cramps. My cycle is just finishing up, and I popped more advils this past week then  ever before. In my quest for a cure, I stumbled upon a blog post titled "<a href="http://therawdivas.com/blog/?cat=22" title="The Low, Down and Dirty About Cooked Foods" target="_blank">The Low, Down and Dirty About Cooked Foods</a>" from The Raw Divas site. In that post Tera says that after going raw she stopped having pms and cramps... could she be on to something?? With this in mind, I decided to try their <a href="http://therawdivas.com/" title="The Raw Diva's 7 Day Detox" target="_blank">7 Day Detox</a>. It's totally free to do and challenging as heck for someone like me who loves cooked foods. I officially started yesterday, and I can already hear my ego voice trying to convince me that I should quit. It's starting to win. *Sigh*

Hmmm... I think the break from cooked food has got me thinking some more on what may be the real cause of my cramps. Maybe this is my ego's attempt at looking for a way out of becoming a raw vegan :P... The more I think about it, I'm almost positive that caffeine and dairy are the major culprits. I can give up caffeine and dairy, just not sure I'm ready to totally give up all cooked foods yet. Nice going ego.

Speaking of ego, I also decided to start reading <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0452289963?ie=UTF8&amp;tag=natashaswor04-20&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=9325&amp;creativeASIN=0452289963" target="_blank" title="A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose">A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose </a> by Eckhart Tolle and to follow along with <a href="http://www2.oprah.com/index.jhtml" title="Oprah Winfrey" target="_blank">Oprah and Eckhart's Monday night classes</a>.  I'm just finishing up chapter 2 and I must say, it's a lot to grasp. He speaks quite a bit about the dysfunction of identifying ourselves with our ego and all the many things that it wants and needs. As I read this book, I can't help but to think that maybe I'm not quite awakened yet. Or maybe that's what my ego wants me to believe... Nonetheless, I intend to read the entire book and follow along with the classes. I find that I comprehend the book better after I watch the videos.

Anyhow, I gotta go. 'Til next time. ;)]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Acupuncture]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[yip@trueacu.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://acupuncture-n-herbs.com/acupuncture-n-herbs-recent-posts/</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[24.9.64.136]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-06-17 00:31:18]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-06-17 05:31:18]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[If you don't mind me pointing out, according to Chinese Medicine, a pure raw food diet can be quite harsh on the whole body. Raw foods tend to be cold in nature and your body has to first warm up the food (to the body's temp), then take more energy to digest it. If it uses all it's energy to warm the food, there's little to no energy left to for proper digestion. So your urge for cooked foods is a good one!

As for cramps, as an acupuncturist, I treat PMS and other symptoms with acupuncture and Chinese herbs with great success! It's all about bringing your body back into balance so it can function the way it's supposed to. Avoiding foods may help, especially if you have severe food allergies, but to me, it's probably not the most effective route... And yeah, our minds have so much to do with our health! Thanks for the info in your post.

Acupunctures last blog post..<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/AcupunctureNHerbs/~3/307438403/">Acupuncture Denver, CO</a>]]></wp:comment_content>

Natasha wanted to get rid of cramps which is the root cause of cooked food and diary products.  She liked it so much.  The trick she has made is she had avoided those food and read books like A New Earth and Oprah and Eckhat&#39;s night classes to divert her mind.  Anyway she is successful.  Do you have any idea to divert your mind.]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[]]></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Falling off the Wagon and Letting Go</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/12/falling-off-the-wagon-and-letting-go/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Mar 2008 14:59:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/12/falling-off-the-wagon-and-letting-go/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ok, I have a confession to make.... I fell off the <a href="http://therawdivas.com/" title="7 day Detox" target="_blank">7 Day Detox</a> wagon hardcore. I'm going to continue to do raw days , maybe 2 at a time with breaks in between. I did really well from Sunday night 6pm until last night 6pm, then it all went downhill from there. I was on the way to the nursing home to see mom, hungry as heck, then I thought to myself, "This is ridiculous!". So off to Panda express I went, but I did good (considering it was cooked). I got mixed veggies as a side, string bean chicken and mandarin chicken for entres. However, I can't totally give my self a pat on the back... I made a snack stop at Target and got me some Blue Corn Tortilla Chips, Organic Salsa and Macademia Nut Corn Clusters. I know, I know...

So I arrive at the nursing home, feeling stuffed from all my newly bought treats. Moments later, I was told that one of my mom's roommates at the nursing home decided to have doctors take her off the ventilator. She was the only resident, aside from my mom, that I got close to since I used to call her sons for her all the time. The news of this hit me pretty hard, and I was up late munching... I am such an emotional eater. But as sad as it made me, I totally understand why she would decide to let go. She was suffering a lot and to make it worse, she was completely aware and lucid. There's only so much a person can go through. I don't know if she's still here, but I plan on calling her sons to find out later today. :(

Well, I better get going. I'm taking a break from the detox today, but will try again tomorrow. Have a blessed day and try to stay in the present.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>47</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2008-03-12 09:59:33]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-03-12 14:59:33]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[falling-off-the-wagon-and-letting-go]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="detox"><![CDATA[detox]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="mom"><![CDATA[mom]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="nursing-home"><![CDATA[nursing home]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="people"><![CDATA[People]]></category>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[ratings_users]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[ratings_score]]></wp:meta_key>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>305</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Amy]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[amy@therawdivas.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://www.therawdivas.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[76.108.163.110]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-03-12 13:41:50]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-03-12 18:41:50]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi Natasha,

You're busted!  Just kidding!  =)  

Sorry to hear about the rough day you had.  Learning to work against the desire to eat emotionally is a bit of a journey, and it takes some serious will power and practice.  Don't beat yourself up over the this!  

The detox isn't something that is "ruined" because you messed up for one dish, or one meal, or one day, or even more... if it is something you want to experience, just start again!  It really is that easy.

If you didn't listen to the recorded Q&amp;A welcome call, I highly recommend giving that a listen before you begin next time.  It might be just the inspiration you need to get you through the times you want to fall off the wagon.

At worst, you learned that you need to always have some snacks with you so you can avoid Panda Express (some baby carrots in a baggie, a couple of apples, or other fruit) and lots of water.  The emotional stuff can sneak up on you, but in a situation where that is not at play, just keep reminding yourself that it is just 7 days, and after that 7 days, you will allow yourself whatever you desire, if you still desire it.  Keeping this 7 day commitment to yourself is really empowering!  Avoiding getting too hungry can really help.

If you try again, good luck!  We'll be thinking of you!

Amy]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Customer Service Hell</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/18/customer-service-hell/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 18 Mar 2008 18:42:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/18/customer-service-hell/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I decided on Sunday that paying for Office Depot's Brand Performance Protection Plan for my HP Pavillion was not the wisest decision I ever made. One of my buttons broke off and it was hell just to get a claim approved. Funny thing is when I had the same issue with my iBook, Apple quickly replaced my keyboard. When I called back to request for a different UPS label since I moved, the Customer Service Rep told me to scratch out my old address. When I called UPS to confirm if this was ok, they told me it wasn't. To top it off,  my battery suddenly died. Unsurprisingly,  batteries are not covered under this plan. Go figure.

Anyways, in the spirit of customer service hell, here's a video that brings it all home. If you've never heard the term "Dell Hell" before, you're about to experience it now. Funny video and a true story. Enjoy!
<pre>
<object height="355" width="425">
<param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/Ryas9OANw-E"></param>
<param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/Ryas9OANw-E" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" height="355" width="425"></embed></object></pre>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[]]></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Intentions and Weight Loss</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/03/30/intentions-and-weight-loss/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Mar 2008 02:05:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=49</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today, I realized that my past failures with weight loss may have a lot to do with my intentions. I noticed that every single time I've decided to start a detox or new fitness regime, my reason were always something like me wanting to look so good that I turn heads, or because I want attract the man of my dream, etc. Never has my reason been purely for the sake of doing something good for my body. Imagine that... to desire to be in the best health/fitness level possible simply because I love myself... What a concept.

--------------

I was reading a post by Dhrumil on the "<a title="We Like it Raw" href="http://www.welikeitraw.com/" target="_blank">We Like it Raw</a>" blog where he featured the video of  Jill Bolte Taylor's stroke experience. I thought it was so inspiring that I've decided to post it here. If you have about 20 minutes to spare, then I invite you to kick back, relax and enjoy.

<!--cut and paste--><object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="432" height="285" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="id" value="VE_Player" /><param name="align" value="middle" /><param name="FlashVars" value="bgColor=FFFFFF&amp;file=http://static.videoegg.com/ted/movies/JILLTAYLOR-2008_high.flv&amp;autoPlay=false&amp;fullscreenURL=http://static.videoegg.com/ted/flash/fullscreen.html&amp;forcePlay=false&amp;logo=&amp;allowFullscreen=true" /><param name="quality" value="high" /><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" /><param name="bgcolor" value="#FFFFFF" /><param name="scale" value="noscale" /><param name="wmode" value="window" /><param name="src" value="http://static.videoegg.com/ted2/flash/loader.swf" /><embed id="VE_Player" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="432" height="285" src="http://static.videoegg.com/ted2/flash/loader.swf" wmode="window" scale="noscale" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" allowscriptaccess="always" quality="high" flashvars="bgColor=FFFFFF&amp;file=http://static.videoegg.com/ted/movies/JILLTAYLOR-2008_high.flv&amp;autoPlay=false&amp;fullscreenURL=http://static.videoegg.com/ted/flash/fullscreen.html&amp;forcePlay=false&amp;logo=&amp;allowFullscreen=true" align="middle"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>

I once took these diet pills from china that made you lose your appetite but had tons of side effects. I wanted to be thin sooo bad cause I wanted to look good. I ended up getting really sick because of it. These days, although I still wanna be thin, I just make sure I eat fruits and vegetables and less of the sweet stuff.

	<item>
		<title>Elephants and Art Skills</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/04/03/elephants-and-art-skills/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Apr 2008 12:15:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=50</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Do you believe that humans are superior to animals in <em>every</em> way? I used to, but lately my spirit has been showing me that what I was taught may not be accurate. Then to top it off, I received this video today. Check it out and let me know what you think. Since embedding of this video was disabled, you can watch it by visiting the following link:

<a title="Elephant Artisan" href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=He7Ge7Sogrk" target="_blank">http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=He7Ge7Sogrk</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The World&#039;s Shortest Fairy Tale, Retold</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/04/08/the-worlds-shortest-fairy-tale-retold/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Apr 2008 21:23:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=53</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>A friend emailed the following story to me today. This is the tweaked version. Enjoy. :)</p>
<strong>
THE WORLD'S SHORTEST FAIRYTALE</strong>

<p>Once upon a time, a guy asked a girl "Will you marry me?"</p>

<p>The girl said: "NO!". And the girl lived happily ever-after and went shopping, dancing, camping, always had a clean house, never cooked, did whatever the hell she wanted, never argued, didn't gain weight, traveled more, had fun going on dates, had plenty of money, and had all the hot water to herself. She went to the movies, never had to watch sports, never wore friggin' lacy lingerie that went up her butt crack, had high self esteem, never cried or yelled, felt and looked fabulous in sweat pants and was pleasant all the time.</p>

<p>The End</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

Now we grocery shop, do aerobics to the wiggles dvds, and wade through oceans of stuffed toys and half-chewed crusts to have a quick luke-warm shower, before it's time to don those tunnel-elastic mum-knickers and droopy sweat pants.

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Time for Tough Questions</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/04/18/time-for-tough-questions/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 18 Apr 2008 22:11:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=54</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Another friend emailed this to me and I was like, "Wow".  I've edited and tweaked it for the web. Just doing my part to pass on this timely message. Peace.

<strong>*************</strong>

<strong>Question 1: </strong>

It is time to elect a new world leader, and only your vote counts. Here are the facts about the three candidates. Who would you vote for?

<strong>C</strong>andidate <strong>A</strong>
<ul>
	<li>Associates with crooked politicians</li>
	<li>Consults with astrologist</li>
	<li>He's had two mistresses</li>
	<li>He also chain smokes</li>
	<li>Drinks 8 to 10 martinis a day</li>
</ul>
<strong>C</strong>andidate <strong>B</strong>
<ul>
	<li>He was kicked out of office twice</li>
	<li>Sleeps until noon</li>
	<li>Used opium in college</li>
	<li>Drinks a quart of whiskey every evening</li>
</ul>
<strong>C</strong>andidate <strong>C
</strong>
<ul>
	<li>He is a decorated war hero</li>
	<li>He's a vegetarian</li>
	<li>He doesn't smoke</li>
	<li>He drinks an occasional beer</li>
	<li>He never cheated on his wife.</li>
</ul>
Which of these candidates would be your choice?

Decide first before reading any further... I'll give you a few seconds...

****

<a href="javascript:collapse1.slideit()">Click here to reveal who your candidates are: </a>
<div id="answer1">
<ul>
	<li>Candidate A is Franklin D. Roosevelt.</li>
	<li>Candidate B is Winston Churchill.</li>
	<li>Candidate C is Adolph Hitler.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<script type="text/javascript"><!--
var collapse1=new animatedcollapse("answer1", 500, false)
// --></script>

Pretty interesting isn't it?

<strong>Remember: </strong>

Amateurs...built the ark.
Professionals...built the Titanic.

And Finally, can you imagine working for a company that has a little more than 500 employees and has the following statistics:
<ul>
	<li>29 have been accused of spousal abuse</li>
	<li>7 have been arrested for fraud</li>
	<li>19 have been accused of writing bad checks</li>
	<li>117 have directly or indirectly bankrupted at least 2 businesses</li>
	<li>3 have done time for assault</li>
	<li>71 cannot get a credit card due to bad credit</li>
	<li>14 have been arrested on drug-related charges</li>
	<li>8 have been arrested for shoplifting</li>
	<li>21 are currently defendants in lawsuits</li>
	<li> 84 have been arrested for drunk driving in the last year...</li>
</ul>
Can you guess which organization this is? Go on, take a few secs if you need it...

*****

<a href="javascript:collapse2.slideit()">Click here to reveal the answer.</a>
<div id="answer2">It's the 535 members of the United States Congress. The same group that crank out hundreds of new laws each year designed to keep the rest of us in line.</div>
<script type="text/javascript"><!--
var collapse2=new animatedcollapse("answer2", 500, false)
// --></script>Know all the facts, think before judging someone......And vote.

If you found this post interesting, great! Simply click on the "ShareThis" link below and pass it on.

<strong>Update:</strong> As I mentioned earlier, this post is based on an email that was sent to me, and I found the message so timely that I quickly posted it. It was pointed out to me today that some of the facts maybe inaccurate, so I did some research and decided to remove one of the questions. As for the stats, to be honest I'm not sure where they came from. However, Congress is made up of imperfect people, and that's the whole point. Nonetheless, what's important is the message behind this post. Thanks for reading. :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi nomdeplume and Jesus, thanks for your comments.

Jesus - that is the point... it is deceptive.. Sadly, this type of deceptions happens often and many people fall for it. I purposely hid the answers to see if any readers would ask for more information on the candidtaes before making a decision, but so far none have. Instead I have gotten either surprised reactions or anger when they discover that the person who sounded like the best candidate is as you say a "psychotic anti-Semite".]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_approved><![CDATA[1]]></wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[]]></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
		<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>412</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Natasha]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[webqueen@natashasworld.com]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://natashasworld.com/</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[75.74.105.107]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-04-22 06:53:16]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-04-22 11:53:16]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi all thanks for the comments.

Barbara, Geoserv - I had the same initial reaction. I was so moved that I felt compelled to share this email.

John - Thanks for the heads up. I received the email from a friend and I admit that the last thing on my mind was to do research on it. The information seemed possible, so I posted it. After I read your comment,  I decided to check out snopes.com. After reading about Beethoven, I decided to remove the first question because the facts were off. However, after I dug a little further, I found out that even snopes.com was not completely accurate. According to <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_van_Beethoven" target="_blank">Wikipedia</a> he was Maria Magdelena's 2nd child , not her 3rd. Anyways, I removed the question all together because I felt the rest of the post still made a good point without it.

As for Hitler, it turns out that the examples listed above are accurate, but taken out of context to make a point. By looking at those "facts", one would assume that the person being described was a kind hearted individual, but from history we know the truth. In reality, he was a veteran, he was vegetarian for a period of time due to stomach ailments, he drank occasionally and stopped smoking in his later years. He also had his affairs outside of marriage. But now that we know who this is describing, does it make a difference?

Sources:
<a href="http://www.snopes.com/glurge/twoquestions.asp" target="_blank">http://www.snopes.com/glurge/twoquestions.asp</a>
<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegetarianism_of_Adolf_Hitler" target="_blank">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegetarianism_of_Adolf_Hitler</a>
<a href="http://constitutionalistnc.tripod.com/hitler-leftist/id1.html" target="_blank">http://constitutionalistnc.tripod.com/hitler-leftist/id1.html</a>

TootieLizardTush - The intention for posting the email wasn't to begin propaganda. The message behind this post is one everyone needs to think about. And that message is to not judge people based on random facts from their lives that could easily be taken out of context.]]></wp:comment_content>

		</wp:comment>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>An Update and a Cute Story</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/02/an-update-and-a-cute-story/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 03 May 2008 03:04:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=55</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Have you ever felt so tired when you get home from work that the thought of typing made you cringe? Well, that's how I've been feeling lately, hence why I haven't been posting much. So, while I deal with my energy crisis, I'll share with you a cute story my friend emailed me. Don't worry,  there are no politics or negativity in this post,  just funniness . Enjoy. :)

--------------

One day my mother was out and my dad was in charge of me. I was maybe 2 1/2 years old and had just recovered from an accident. Someone had given me a little 'tea set' as a get-well gift and it was one of my favorite toys. Daddy was in the living room engrossed in the evening news when I brought Daddy a little cup of "tea", which was just water.

After several cups of tea and lots of praise for such yummy tea, my Mom came home. My Dad made her wait in the living room to watch me bring him a cup of tea, because it was "just the cutest thing!". My Mom waited, and sure enough, here I come down the hall with a cup of tea for Daddy and she watches him drink it up. Then she says, "Did it ever occur to you that the only place that baby can reach to get water is the toilet?"]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Words of Wisdom</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/13/words-of-wisdom/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2008 03:30:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=59</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I was in the process of working on a post when I realized that my friend Z updated her blog (it's about time!!). Her father sent her an email and naturally the post was very insightful. So, while I work on my update, be sure to check out  <a title="Words of Wisdom from My Father..." href="http://theperennialgarden.blogspot.com/2008/05/words-of-wisdom-from-my-father_02.html" target="_blank">"Words of Wisdom from My Father. . ."</a> by Zenobia. Peace.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>59</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2008-05-13 22:30:33]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-05-14 03:30:33]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[words-of-wisdom]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

	<item>
		<title>Keith Olbermann&#039;s Commentary</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/16/keith-olbermanns-commentary/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 17 May 2008 03:29:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=60</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I was really trying not to get into too much politics and governmental issues on my blog, but to heck with it. I was chillin' with Mom the other night when Keith Olbermann from MSNBC did a commentary on George Bush. For those of you who haven't seen it yet, I've included both parts below. I encourage you to watch this, especially if you support Bush and his policies. Olbermann spoke the truth, and it is exactly what everyone needs to hear.

Part 1
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="355" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/8Qtn128cAI8&amp;hl=en" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="355" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/8Qtn128cAI8&amp;hl=en" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>

Part 2
<object width="425" height="355"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/L0N0B2dnl7o&hl=en"></param><param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/L0N0B2dnl7o&hl=en" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" width="425" height="355"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[French-Australian, I lived in the US for 10 years between 1989 and 1999.  On September 11, I stayed up all night in my apartment in Paris crying as I watched the towers crumbling down. I cried again when Bush was elected. You see, the US are in my heart my second home. Deeply, truly.  
I went back to the US for 2 years from 2005 to 2007.  Clearly, a lot had changed. I don't want to go into all the details, it would take me too many pages but to summurize how i felt, I'd say the Freedom was not the same anymore. 
And as I travel and live abroad, I heard sad comments about your country. So I always tried to explain how what they saw and heard in the news is not the truth at all about the United States. 
So thank you for posting these videos. I hope a lot of people can watch these and realize how American people are a great people. 
Love, Anne]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>This is what I see Part 1</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/19/this-is-what-i-see-part-1/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 May 2008 02:53:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=61</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[For the past few weeks, I have silently observed quite a few things that made me sad. Maybe others don't see what I see and that's fine by me. Nonetheless,  today I will share 2 of these things with the world. I will not quote any statistics, I will only state what I see... take it or leave it.

1. Obama May be in Danger

There is a lot of concern among African Americans that Senator Barack Obama's fate may be the same as John F. Kennedy's or Martin Luther King's. Personally, I believe that all candidates risk their lives and those of their loved ones when they decide to run for office, but this isn't the danger that I see. Obama has proven time and again that he is both a gentlemen and a man of integrity. Unfortunately, in politics that level of integrity will be tested. I see that Obama is in danger of becoming like any typical politician if he forgets his original reason for desiring to be President of the U.S. Typical politicians tend to forget that being in office is all about the people and not about them. I pray that Obama never forgets.

2. Hilary May be in Danger

Bill Clinton was a good President. During his years in office, the economy was good and our relationship across the border was as good as it could be considering the times. However, he is not the one running for office, Senator Hilary Clinton is. In case anyone hasn't noticed, Hilary and Bill are 2 completely different people with different ideas on what's best for the U.S. So what does this have to do with Hilary being in danger you ask? I fear for her soul. Keep reading.

I don't consider myself a religious, but I truly respect the Bible. Since Hilary recently quoted scripture,  then I have to ask this question, quoting Jesus himself, "What good is it for a man to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit his very self?" (Luke 9: 26) Is the hope of winning a contest worth splitting up a democratic party? It is no coincidence that over 50% of Clinton supporters would rather not vote or vote for McCain if she is not the Democratic candidate.  "For each tree is known by its own fruit." (Luke 6:44). "For there is no good tree which produces bad fruit, nor, on the other hand, a bad tree which produces good fruit." (Luke 6:43). To have supporters that care more for getting what they want then for democratic party is a testimony to the type of campaign that she has been running. Also, is this not one way to attempt to force the hand of the superdelegates? I pray that Hilary will stop and contemplate what she has done and what she is about to do... My question to Hilary is: Are you sure this contest is worth forfeiting your very self?

----

I see so much more, but I have somewhere to be right now. My intentions are not to offend anyone, this is simply what I see.

]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-05-25 06:55:45]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I do not believe to any politician, that he want only the best for the country, so it is somehow strange for me to read how some people still trust them. I do not mean, that trusting them is a bad thing, I just loosed all the hope, that anybody "clean" might be in that dirty game. 
I just hope, that you American vote for somebody who do not want to start the 3rd world war, like Bush, and will stabilize the economic. By the way, do you American watch Moore´s movies? In the Sicko the showed the American health care system and that Hillary wanted to normalize it, like it is in the rest of the world, where everybody pays for health care to one organization and you get free health care every time you go to the hospital, but those insurance corporation paid her to be quiet about that plan... I wonder what is true about it... Even if it is true, I would not blame her for that, because if she would not take the money, the insurance corporations could bring her down in a massive anti-campaign... And those corporation have the money, and so the power too.]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>A Helping Hand</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/26/a-helping-hand/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 26 May 2008 22:17:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=62</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The following post touched me and so I've decided to repost it here. Any help you can offer would be much appreciated.

--------------------------------

From <a title="Angela Stokes" href="http://rawreform.blogspot.com/2008/05/show-your-love.html" target="_blank"> Angela Stokes's Blog</a>
--------------------------------

Are you familiar with the world of <a title="Raw Baby Alex and Mom Melissa Gilbert" href="http://rawmom.blogspot.com/" target="_blank">'RawBabyAlex' and mum Melissa Gilbert</a>? If not, Melissa has been documenting her raw food baby's progress online for quite some time and it makes fascinating reading – especially for anyone interested in raising kids raw. Melissa has actually compiled two wonderful e-books of all the different recipes that Alex has loved as he's been growing up, from baby foods to toddler treats. (He is such a healthy big boy now that his blog has actually been moved along to 'Raw ToddlerAlex' ;) Melissa also keeps her own lovely blog at <a title="Raw Mom" href="http://rawmom.blogspot.com/" target="_blank">RawMom.blogspot.com</a>, as well as writing regularly for the info-packed raw magazine Pear.

Unfortunately, this amazing little raw family are having some pretty challenging times at present...in February they were burgled and all their possessions were taken. They moved house and even state, only to discover that they cannot find work in their new location and that very soon they will likely be homeless. They are in a time of crisis. On her most recent blog, Melissa writes that she visited the local food bank to try to get something to eat. They had no raw foods, except 5 bunches of celery, which they gave her. When she got home however, she realised they were almost totally rotten and unusable. Melissa is an incredible mother and gives tirelessly and with so much love to the raw community through her writings. I would feel so sad to see this amazing young family living out in the scorching Arizona desert in a tent with seemingly nowhere left to turn. They really could use some support right now - this is an opportunity to help out an incredible raw family. Instead of just asking people to donate money to help them with their situation however, I'd love to recommend that you invest in Melissa's 2 fabulous ebooks – <a title="Sun-Sational Raw Baby Food and Sun-Sational Smoothies" href="http://rawmom.blogspot.com/" target="_blank">'Sunsational Raw Baby Food' and 'Sun-Sational Smoothies'</a>. They are just $10 each, available from her site HERE. Imagine the difference $20 could make to a family that is in dire straits right now...and YOU get smthg wonderful too – two recipe books packed with tried-and-tested recipes ;) I sincerely hope the raw food community will reach out and support this loving family unit in their time of need...please feel free to re-post this message and pass it along to others in the raw food community too...and enjoy the recipes ;)

(P.S. If you DO feel moved to simply send a donation to the family, their Paypal email address is <a href="mailto:loverawlife@gmail.com">loverawlife@gmail.com</a>)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>This is what I see Part 2: Clinton, Obama, JFK Assisination, Liz Trotta</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/05/27/this-is-what-i-see-part-2-clinton-obama-jfk-assisination-liz-trotta/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 May 2008 18:18:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=63</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you have been following the news, you may have already heard about Senator Hillary Clinton's  comment in regards to Senator Barack Obama and the JFK Assassination. If not, here's a Special commentary on this topic by Keith Olbermann:

<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="355" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/y9QahLcsVZA&amp;hl=en" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="355" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/y9QahLcsVZA&amp;hl=en" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>

Regardless of what anyone says, I have a hard time believing that Hillary's comment was innocent and that she didn't mean to imply an ill fate for Obama.

Then, just when you think it can't get any worse, Liz Trotta from Fox News makes one of the most appalling comment I've heard since this election started:

<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="355" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/8T5eDDL1WuM" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="355" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/8T5eDDL1WuM" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>

She later offers the following apology, but it's a little too late. No apology can excuse such a comment...

<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="355" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/ZvjRv3Xhy-s&amp;hl=en" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="355" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/ZvjRv3Xhy-s&amp;hl=en" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>

I pray that God looks over Obama and his Family.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>This Blog IS NOT A Political Blog!</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/06/04/this-blog-is-not-a-political-blog/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 05 Jun 2008 01:25:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=64</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Just a quick note to remind everyone that although my last couple of post have been on politics, natashasword.com is not a political blog at all.  If you don't believe me, check out the categories to see the different topis that I've written about.

However, since we're on the topic of politics,

CONGRATULATIONS SENATOR  BARACK OBAMA, YOU RAWK!!!!

Yesterday was an historical day, and I am grateful that me and my family are here to witness it. When I first announced that I was supporting Senator Obama, this was my main reason:
<blockquote>We no longer have to look to entertainers who have no clue what it means to be a good example as role models for success. Change is here. Everytime you start to forget how much you can achieve, go to <a title="Google" href="http://www.google.com/" target="_blank">Google.com</a> and type Barack Obama.</blockquote>
June 3rd, 2008 confirmed it.

In other news, natashasworld.com will soon be getting a complete facelift. I'm working on a new template and will be adding a couple of new sections. Stay tuned!]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A Video for you and a Brief Update</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/06/07/some-entertainment-for-you/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 Jun 2008 19:07:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=65</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I just got back from a Living on Live Food Chef Certification Class and it was awesome! The food was so yummy and I learned a lot. My teacher was Stacey Weckstein from <a title="Stacey Weckstein from radiantmindandbody.com" href="http://radiantmindandbody.com" target="_blank">radiantmindandbody.com</a>. Be sure to check her site out.

In other news, I am still working on a new look and feel for <a title="Natasha's World" href="http://natashasworld.com/journal/" target="_self">Natasha's World</a>, but it's going to take a little longer then I thought since I've hit a semi-designer's block. As I work a few things out here's a little entertainment for you. I first saw this video over at <a title="Jia-tv" href="http://jia-tv.com/2008/06/06/hilarious.aspx" target="_blank">Jia's</a> and I knew I had to share it with y'all. I must warn you, there is profanity in this video and the reenactment that the boy is doing may be a bit disturbing to some of you. But this is reality and you have to admit that this kid is a great actor. Let me know what you think.

<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="448" height="361" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="src" value="http://i161.photobucket.com/flash/player.swf?file=http://vid161.photobucket.com/albums/t223/MasterxMarsx/MVI_1271_2.flv" /><param name="wmode" value="transparent" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="448" height="361" src="http://i161.photobucket.com/flash/player.swf?file=http://vid161.photobucket.com/albums/t223/MasterxMarsx/MVI_1271_2.flv" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[75.74.105.107]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-06-07 14:41:25]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-06-07 19:41:25]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Heya Z, I admit that it is sad that this boy had to witness something like this. At the same time, I am for all forms of self expression. I have seen too many kids (me included) grow up in environments where we had almost no outlets to release negative energy that build up from having to live through these types of scenarios. Thank goodness, I was able to eventually learn how to release and express myself through various forms of art . This boy is releasing by acting out what he saw on video. Is watching this video more disturbing then watching a movie like "Training Day" with Denzel Washington? Maybe, or maybe not. I 'll let you be the judge.]]></wp:comment_content>

Denzel went home after making the movie and all was well.  This is most likely not the case for the child in this video.
