	<item>
		<title>An Award and Some Updates</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/06/25/an-award-and-some-updates/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jun 2008 11:36:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=66</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://natashasworld.com/journal/wp-content/uploads/2008/06/arte1.jpg"><img class="no_border_space" title="arte1" src="http://natashasworld.com/journal/wp-content/uploads/2008/06/arte1.jpg" alt="Arte y Pico Award" width="96" height="160" align="left" /></a>To start off, I would like to thank my buddy <a title="Zenobia - From the Battlefield" href="http://www.from-the-battlefield.blogspot.com/" target="_blank">Zenobia</a> for nominating my site for the
<a href="http://from-the-battlefield.blogspot.com/2008/06/thank-you-marvalus-for-recognizing-my.html">Arte y Pico Award</a>. There are some rules that I'm supposed to follow, where I list other bloggers I want to give the award to, and they're supposed to do the same, blah blah. Z is going to kill me for saying this, but doesn't that sound like too much work? Instead, I would like to declare that all the folks on my Favorites list get an award because they're cool. Yeah, I know I'm changing the rules, but this is <a title="Natasha's World" href="http://natashasworld.com/" target="_self">Natasha's World</a> and I can do that. Congrats everyone!!

<em>(Disclaimer: This new declaration is not applicable outside of natashasworld.com. Any attempts to use this declaration is done at your own risk.)</em>

-------------------

I promise you there is a method to my madness. I know it may appear that I haven't been updating this blog often, but it is all an illusion. You are in a dream state, and things are not as they seem...

Ok, to be real, I needed to take a brief hiatus from this site. Before I go any further, I would like to take a few seconds to give my blog a quick hug for neglecting it for the past couple of weeks:

*~HUGS NATASHA'S WORLD BLOG TIGHT*~

As I was saying, I was dealing with some serious designer block issues (amongst other things), to the point where I was considering going back to farming. If you're confused as to what farming has to do with anything, check out my <a title="Natasha got Tagged" href="http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/01/10/32/">Tagged</a> video for more info.

Anyhow, after months of staring at a blank Photoshop canvas, I was starting to get desperate. I work as an HTML Developer who also needs to be able to design. No Design could mean No Pay.  The moment that I decided that I would do anything to get my creative juices flowing again, God stepped in and I recieved an email from Shawn Casey regarding <a title="Justin Blake Manifestation Meditation Tool" href="http://natashasworld.com/go/?JustinBlake" target="_blank">Justin Blake's Manifestation Meditation Tool</a>. At first it flipped me out a bit because he started talking about how it could be alien technology. But then I was like, "Natasha, who are you kidding? Aren't you the same one that believes in the possibility that humans may be half monkey, half alien? Pulease!" Yeah, I know....

So out of desperation and the fact that it comes with a 6 month money back guarantee, I decided to give <a title="Manifestation Meditation" href="http://natashasworld.com/go/?JustinBlake" target="_blank">Manifestation Meditation</a> a shot. The experience was very relaxing and I fell asleep. After I woke up, I felt rested but wasn't sure if it worked.  I then sat in front of my computer and started up Photoshop...

Would you believe me if I told you that the same night I was able to create a new header and template for my site? It was the most progress  I've had in months. Maybe it was a placebo affect, but who cares... something worked!! I can't wait to try it out on some other stuff to see what happens. If you want more information, click <a title="Manifestation Meditation" href="http://natashasworld.com/go/?JustinBlake" target="_blank">here</a>. If you should decide to try it, please let me know your results.

Lastly, I haven't abandoned my weight loss efforts. I have been in a secret little competition that I will write about more in future post. Cool things are happening behind the scenes, and a new layout is finally under way. Stay tuned and have a blessed day!]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>July 4th Update</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/04/july-4th-update/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 04 Jul 2008 16:45:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/04/july-4th-update/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="float: right; margin-left: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;"><a title="photo sharing" href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/noname/749445903/"><img class="border" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1397/749445903_ceabc6b854_m.jpg" alt="" /></a>
</div>
To start off, Happy Independence Day everyone!! I hope you have a safe and fun weekend. The development for this site had to be put on a temporary hold as I had a bit of a stomach issue the past couple of weeks. This weekend, I feel better then ever and am ready to pick up where I left off.

Yes that's right, while you all over do it on ribs and barbecue chicken, I will be at my computer, working on my site. But I do have every intention to not miss any fireworks tonight. Be safe.]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Disappointments, Time Wasted and Silver Lining</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/05/disappointments-time-wasted-and-silver-lining/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 05 Jul 2008 22:33:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/05/disappointments-time-wasted-and-silver-lining/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yesterday was a good day. I worked on my new layout for almost 10 hours and was very happy with the progress I was making. I then took a break to go chill with my mom at the nursing home and caught whatever little fireworks I could, especially since we got rained out. <br /><br />I came back home and worked a little more until I started to get sleepy. I saved my file, but then my system froze. "No big deal", I thought to myself. I then did a forced restart and went to bed. <br /><br />This morning, I was up by 8am and ready to get back to work. I did my lil morning routine, got myself some grapes and checked my emails. Then I fired up Photoshop and was ready to go. I open up my file, only to see a black page with red stuff on it, no layers to be found. <br /><br />"This must be some kind of error," I thought. So I restarted Photoshop, but still the same deal. I did a lil searching around in Google only to find out that others have experienced the same thing before, and that my file got corrupted. After trying many PSD recovery software, I came to the conclusion that my work may be lost forever. <br /><br />I then decided that it was time to do a disk check. This caused some issues at first, but I was finally able to run it. Unfortunately when it got to stage 5 of 5, I got a "Hard Fail". I then did a Bios diagnostic test and that also failed. To make a long story short, my hard drive is dying. I am just grateful I caught it in time.<br /><br />Between this morning and now, I can honestly say that I experienced the 5 stages of death, but in this case it is the slow death of my hard drive:<br /><br /><ol><li><b>Denial</b> - For 2 hours straight I was in a state of denial that my file may actually be corrupted and was hell bent on correcting the problem.<br /></li><li><b>Anger</b> - This is when it got really interesting. I came really close to throwing my laptop across the room at least 10 times today. Really close.</li><li><b>Bargaining</b> - I then prayed that God would work a miracle and fix my file. I promised that I would create a back up in case this should ever happen again. No such luck.</li><li><b>Depression</b> - I then got really sad. I am still really sad.</li><li><b>Acceptance</b> - I finally accepted that this kind of stuff happens. At least I can say I learned something from all this - to always back up my work files on a separate drive. Silver lining in the cloud? Maybe. <br /><br /> I then proceeded to back up my files on an external hard drive and called the warranty company to ask them to send a box. The tech guy was annoying and kept asking if I did a recovery. I had to help him understand that I was almost certain that my issue was more of a hardware issue rather then a software problem. He eventually saw it my way and my box is in the mail.</li></ol><br /><br />So the moral to the story is: Get other people to do design work for you so that you don't have to deal with this BS. No Seriously, please learn from my mistake and keep a backup of your work files on a separate hard drive. Ok? <br />]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Aw man Natasha!  I was so looking forward to checking it out on Monday.  I was even going to try and convince you to give me a sneak peek.  Ah well, I'm glad you got your head together.  I know how these things frustrate you.  It would have drove me crazy too.  To be honest, I'd probably still be picking up small pieces of my PC.

A Voice From the Battlefields last blog post..<a href="http://from-the-battlefield.blogspot.com/2008/07/old-school-vs-new-school-round-1-soul.html">Old School Vs. New School Round 1:  The Soul Train Line</a>]]></wp:comment_content>

			<wp:comment_id>1010</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Natasha]]></wp:comment_author>

			<wp:comment_author_url></wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[75.74.105.107]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-07-05 23:51:12]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2008-07-06 03:51:12]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[It's funny because just yesterday I was thinking to myself that the only difference between humans and other animals is our ability to reason as apposed to simply acting on instinct. I think this afternoon was one of those times where reason took over. 

If I had thrown my HP across the room, as my instincts suggested, I would have also destroyed my 256mb graphics card that it comes with.  I would have been left with my little ibook that has only a 32mb graphics card. That would mean no more  Second Life or any 3d online games. We simply can't have that... not yet anyways.]]></wp:comment_content>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Love After Love</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/09/love-after-love/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Jul 2008 21:02:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/09/love-after-love/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A friend from work suggested I watch an interview that <a title="Oprah Winfrey and&lt;br/&gt;Jon Kabat-Zinn - Soul Series" href="http://www2.oprah.com/spiritself/oss/guest/oss_guest_jkabatzinn.jhtml" target="_blank">Oprah had with
Jon Kabat-Zinn</a> and the interview was awesome. During their conversation,
the following poem was mentioned and all I can say is, "Wow".
Very simple, yet profound. Enjoy. :)

-------------------------
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Love After Love </strong></p>

<p align="center">The time will come
when, with elation,
you will greet yourself arriving
at your own door, in your own mirror,
and each will smile at the other’s welcome,
and say, sit here. Eat.
You will love again the stranger who was your self.
Give wine. Give bread. Give back your heart
to itself, to the stranger who has loved you
all your life, whom you ignored
for another, who knows you by heart.
Take down the love letters from the bookshelf,
the photographs, the desperate notes,
peel your own image from the mirror.
Sit. Feast on your life.</p>
<p align="center">~ by Derek Walcott ~</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>73</wp:post_id>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>A Poem and an Update</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/29/a-poem-and-an-update/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2008 10:37:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/07/29/a-poem-and-an-update/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I haven't completely abandoned this blog, but I am taking a break from blogging <br />consistently for a while. I'll update here and there to keep you posted on any new developments. Once I find the time to redo this site like I originally intended, regular blogging will start up again.. <br /><br />I have been dealing with a lot of personal dramas, one of which I wrote a little poem about. I normally don't write poetry, but I was up most of the night and felt this intense desire to share my experience with others. This is the first poem I've written in years, so keep that in mind as you read this. Peace.<br /><br />-------------------------------<br /><b><br />Temptations</b><br />by Natasha Pierre-Louis<br /><br /><br />Your are so beautiful,<br />Why didn't I notice you before?<br />You are delightful,<br />Your presence moves me to the core.<br /><br />I want to touch you,<br />but that probably wouldn't be fair.<br />You don't belong to me,<br />your owner's standing over there.<br /><br />But I don't mean no harm,<br />I have no intent to steal...<br />No need to sound the alarm,<br />I simply wanted you to feel...<br /><br />I promise I won't take<br />something that doesn't belong to me.<br />I promise I won't break<br />someone else's property.<br /><br />Alas, I better go, <br />The temptation to steal you is so strong<br />That person doesn't know<br />but my intentions are so wrong.<br /><br />Maybe one day you'll be<br />free to come home and live with me.<br />Till then we'll wait to see<br />if you are  truly my destiny.<br /><br /><br />]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

Barbara Swaffords last blog post..<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/bloggingwithoutablog/DWWZ/~3/350183009/">Interview With Lorelle VanFossen - Part 5 - Managing 350+ Feeds</a>]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>Movie Trailer on Mom</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/08/05/movie-trailer-on-mom/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2008 10:54:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=75</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[My brother <a title="Mike's myspace page" href="http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&amp;friendid=77202184" target="_blank">Mike</a> created a trailer for a documentary on Mom and the Healthcare system back in 2005 and I can't believe that it never occurred to me to post it here before. It's actually featured on my myspace page, which may be the reason.

Anyhow, this video is a short, a little sad, but a definite reality check. Life comes at you hard sometimes and all you can do is roll with it. This too shall pass. Peace.

<a href="http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&amp;videoid=3706177">Mom</a>
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="360" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="src" value="http://mediaservices.myspace.com/services/media/embed.aspx/m=3706177,t=1,mt=video" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="360" src="http://mediaservices.myspace.com/services/media/embed.aspx/m=3706177,t=1,mt=video" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>And2 - The Unofficial Sequel</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/08/01/and2-the-unofficial-sequel/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Aug 2008 10:58:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=76</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[My <a title="My brother Mike" href="http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&amp;friendid=77202184&amp;MyToken=78fce8be-7784-45e3-8a6a-3dd4553daf25" target="_blank">brother</a> created the following spinoff of <a title="AND1" href="http://www.and1.com/" target="_blank">AND1</a> a whiles back and for some reason never took the time to promote it. I think he did a great job for someone who is a newbie in the Film Industry, so I've decided to feature it here.

In case you've never heard of <a title="AND1" href="http://www.and1.com/" target="_blank">AND1</a>, it's a basketball tour of some of the most talented street ball players around. They have had yearly tours all over the U.S. for a while now and my brother is a big fan of the series. Well, a couple of years back he came up with this idea to have fun with it, and created this unofficial sequel on flip side. Without further delay, I present to you AND2. Enjoy!

<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="425" height="344" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/o85ENvSaz84&amp;hl=en&amp;fs=1" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="425" height="344" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/o85ENvSaz84&amp;hl=en&amp;fs=1" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Updates, Politics and McCain Getting Punked?</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/09/10/updates-politics-and-mccain-getting-punked/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Sep 2008 14:13:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/09/10/updates-politics-and-mccain-getting-punked/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I know I haven't been posting much lately.  Until I figure out what direction I want to take this site, I will keep things light and post mainly videos and such. With that said, someone sent the link to this video to me and I thought it was awesome. Yes, it is political, but it's all good. If you're not an Obama supporter, you may not appreciate the humor in this. Nonetheless, much props to the person who created it. Enjoy. :)<br /><br /><br /><div class="youtube-video"><object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/_TiQCJXpbKg&hl=en&amp;fs=1"> </param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"> </param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/_TiQCJXpbKg&hl=en&amp;fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"> </embed> </object></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Updates, Hospitals, Car accident and Weight Loss Success </title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/10/16/updates-hospitals-car-accident-and-weight-loss-success/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Oct 2008 18:52:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=95</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In the past month since I last posted, I have been following the presidential debates from a distance and have also been dealing with some family health issues. My mom was sent to the hospital a bunch of times for feeding tube malfunction and my sister got into a car accident the day she arrived into town. The scare was worse when the doctors diagnosed her with having a bunch of aneurysms as a result of her head cracking the window of the car she was in. To add to the drama, it turns out that the woman who hit the car she was in had just hit another car prior to that and was trying to leave the scene. And to top it off, the woman had no insurance or tag.

Anyways, I also had my own health scare a few weeks ago.  I was at work when I started experiencing chest pains on my left side. I jokingly told my coworkers that I thought I was having a heart attack and they all bust out laughing and soon I joined them. However, the next day the pain was still there. Then the following morning at 5:30am, I woke up sweating and having a hard time breathing. I knocked on my brothers bedroom door to tell him and he quickly rushed me to the ER .

As soon as I mentioned chest pain, the ER staff did not delay to rush me to the doctor. They drew a lot of blood and injected me with this iodine thing that made me feel like I peed myself.  Then they did a CT scan to make sure I didn't have some type of clot.  After what felt like hours of waiting, the doctor finally came in to tell me that they found nothing. He gave me a prescription for pain killers and had me take one with some crackers and apple juice. I burped, felt better and it all suddenly made perfect sense. I had bad gas.

As for my weight loss efforts, I have lost about 20 pounds since I last wrote about wanting to lose weight. Most of my success is due to me incorporating more raw foods into my diet and getting more physically active. Eventually, I will write more details on how I was able to achieve this.  It hasn't been a walk in the park and I did reach a plateau as a result of straying off the wellness path. Good news is that I have been able to maintain my weight and am now ready to pick up where I left off. My goal is to lose the remainder 20 pounds by December 31, 2008.

Well, that's all for now. Be safe. :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="category" nicename="updates"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="weight-loss"><![CDATA[Weight Loss]]></category>

			<wp:comment_id>1694</wp:comment_id>

			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[192.168.2.2]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2008-10-19 21:22:11]]></wp:comment_date>

	<item>
		<title>November &#039;08 Update and a Song</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/11/13/november-08-update-and-a-song/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Nov 2008 08:59:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=123</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Since I last posted, quite a bit has happened in my life. For one, I lived to see the first African-American man be elected as the 44th President of the Unites States of America. Witnessing President Barack Obama give the acceptance speech was one of the proudest moment of my life. I felt as if I were watching my own son. I'm sure the next 4 years are going to be challenging, but I have faith that he can and will move this country in a positive direction.

On the same day as election day, I also recieved my <a title="Gohonzon" href="http://www.sgi-usa.org/memberresources/resources/gohonzon/gohonzon.php" target="_blank">Gohonzon</a>, an object of devotion in <a title="Nicherin Buddhism" href="http://www.sgi-usa.org/buddhism/buddhismofnichirendaishonin.php" target="_blank">Nicherin Buddhism</a>. I was introduced to this form of Buddhism by my friend Ricardo weeks prior and haven't turned back since. As time goes by, I will share more about what I'm learning. In the meantime, you can <a title="Learn More about Buddhism" href="http://www.sgi-usa.org/buddhism/" target="_blank">click here</a> to learn more.

Last but not least, I'll leave you with the lyrics to one of my favorite songs from the early '90s. These words describe some of what I've been experiencing lately. Until next time...

--------------------<strong>
Save the Best for Last
</strong><em>sung by Vanessa Williams
</em>--------------------<strong>
</strong>

Sometimes the snow comes down in June
Sometimes the sun goes round the moon
I see the passion in your eyes
Sometimes it's all a big surprise
'cause there was a time when all I did was wish
You'd tell me this was love
Its not the way I hoped or how I planned
But somehow it's enough

And now we're standing face to face
Isn't this world a crazy place
Just when I thought our chance had passed
You go and save the best for last

All of the nights you came to me
When some silly girl had set you free
You wondered how you'd make it through
I wondered what was wrong with you

'cause how could you give your love to someone else
And share your dreams with me
Sometimes the very thing you're looking for
Is the one thing you can't see

But now we're standing face to face
Isn't this world a crazy place
Just when I thought our chance had passed
You go and save the best for last

Sometimes the very thing you're looking for
Is the one thing you can't see

Sometimes the snow comes down in June
Sometimes the sun goes round the moon
Just when I thought our chance had passed
You go and save the best for last

You went and saved the best for last]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>December &#039;08 Updates and a Song</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/12/09/december-08-updates-and-a-song/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 09 Dec 2008 23:18:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=130</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Wow, I can't believe how quickly this year has gone by. It seems like yesterday that I was celebrating New Years and now Christmas is only 2 weeks away.

Speaking of holidays, this past Thanksgiving reminded me of how much I have to be grateful for. I have been blessed with awesome and patient friends, supportive family, good health, all of my basic necessities and then some, and a job that helps me pay bills and provides me with many opportunities to learn about myself.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!!

In addition to being grateful for my blessings, I have also made the following 3 realizations about building friendship with men:
<ol>
	<li>If I just meet a guy and start falling for him,  maybe what I'm falling for are the character/physical attributes he has that I would want in a future husband.</li>
	<li>Upon considering Realization #1, I should make a running list of these attributes.</li>
	<li>If after Realization # 1 &amp; 2  I still have warm and tingly feelings for this new guy,  then I should be careful not to quickly throw my heart at him. Instead, I could consider allowing the relationship to naturally develop into what it's meant to become.</li>
</ol>
The three realizations above seem so simple, yet it's amazing how many women I meet who never take the time to consider any of them, especially # 2 and #3 - and I have been guilty of this before myself. After applying the three realizations above, I find that I have so much more clarity and my friendships are full of depth while being light and fun.

On that note, I will leave you with the words of one of my favorite songs from one of my favorite Disney movies, "Rodgers And Hammerstein's Cinderella". This song was sang by both Cinderella and the Prince while they danced the night away. Enjoy and Happy Holidays. :)
<p style="text-align: center;">--------------------------------</p>

<p style="text-align: center;">Do I love you because you're beautiful,
or are you beautiful because I love you?
Am I making believe I see in you
a girl too lovely to be really true?

<p style="text-align: center;">Do I want you because you're wonderful,
or are you wonderful because I want you?
Are you the sweet invention of a lover's dream
or are you really as beautiful as you seem?

<p style="text-align: center;">Am I making believe I see in you
a man too perfect to be really true?
Do I want you because you're wonderful,
or are you wonderful because I want you?

<p style="text-align: center;">Are you the sweet invention of a lover's dream
or are you really as wonderful as you seem?
<p style="text-align: center;">--------------------------------</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

Yet, I find that some people tend to build emotional attachments quickly, myself included. In situations like that, where the friendship is still brand spanking new, I have found that the 3 realizations above work well.]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved><![CDATA[1]]></wp:comment_approved>

They grow up after awhile lol...]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved><![CDATA[1]]></wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[]]></wp:comment_type>

			<wp:comment_user_id>0</wp:comment_user_id>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Stream of Life and a Video</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/12/16/stream-of-life-and-a-video/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Dec 2008 19:31:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=140</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[At lunch today my friend Ana told me about a song called "Praan" by Gary Schyman. The song is used in one of the videos from the "<a title="Where the hell is Matt" href="http://www.wherethehellismatt.com/" target="_blank">Where the Hell is Matt</a>" video series.  The lyrics are from the poem <em>The Stream of Life</em> by the Bengali poet <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabindranath_Tagore" target="_blank">Rabindranath Tagore</a>. Below, you'll find the video for where the song is used, but before you check it out, I leave with the English translation of the poem used for the song. Enjoy. :)

----------------------

<strong>Stream of Life</strong>
by <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabindranath_Tagore" target="_blank">Rabindranath Tagore</a>

The same stream of life that runs through my veins night and day
runs through the world and dances in rhythmic measures.

It is the same life that shoots in joy through the dust of the earth
in numberless blades of grass
and breaks into tumultuous waves of leaves and flowers.

It is the same life that is rocked in the ocean-cradle of birth
and of death, in ebb and in flow.

I feel my limbs are made glorious by the touch of this world of life.
And my pride is from the life-throb of ages dancing in my blood this moment.

----------------------
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="400" height="225" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="src" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=1211060&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="400" height="225" src="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=1211060&amp;server=vimeo.com&amp;show_title=1&amp;show_byline=1&amp;show_portrait=0&amp;color=&amp;fullscreen=1" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>
<a href="http://vimeo.com/1211060">Where the Hell is Matt? (2008)</a> from <a href="http://vimeo.com/user484313">Matthew Harding</a> on <a href="http://vimeo.com">Vimeo</a>.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Happy Holidays :)</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2008/12/24/happy-holidays-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Dec 2008 01:41:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=142</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="Oh Well, Happy Holidays! :) by ArtWerk, on Flickr" href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/alphadesigner/2129777527/" border="0" ><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2351/2129777527_af2c9d1015.jpg" alt="Oh Well, Happy Holidays! :)" width="450" height="450" border="0" /></a>

Just wanted to take a few minutes to wish everyone happy and safe Holidays and a wonderful New Year. May all your wishes be granted for the highest good of all.

Namaste. :)]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>First Update of 2009 and a Video</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/01/15/first-update-of-2009-and-a-video/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2009 09:31:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=147</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[To start off, Happy 2009!! My year is going interesting so far. I found out on New Years Eve that my contract was ending with the company I've been with for the past year, and that Friday, January 9, 2009 would be my last day.  With the state of the economy as it is, I know most people in the same situation would be worried. I admit that I was a bit flustered when I first heard. However, with the help of friends and chanting Nam-myoho-renge-kyo, I can honestly say that I am at peace with it. I am actually enjoying my time off.

Anyhow, it wouldn't be right for my first post of the year to not include a video. It just so happens that my friend George Tandy Jr. just posted a video of himself performing "Take His Place" at his live performance last December where he rocked the house!! Enjoy the video, and if you would like to hear more of his music, check out his myspace page - <span class="status_body"><a title="Myspace - George Tandy Jr." href="http://www.myspace.com/georgetandyjr" target="_blank">www.myspace.com/georgetandyjr</a>.</span>

<object width="425" height="344" data="http://www.youtube.com/v/QP7jzyyyIm4&amp;rel=0&amp;color1=0xb1b1b1&amp;color2=0xcfcfcf&amp;hl=en&amp;feature=player_embedded&amp;fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/QP7jzyyyIm4&amp;rel=0&amp;color1=0xb1b1b1&amp;color2=0xcfcfcf&amp;hl=en&amp;feature=player_embedded&amp;fs=1" /><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /></object>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>147</wp:post_id>

			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Oops, I'm late commenting on this one but...Happy New Year to you too!!!  I know the "issue" that you have mentioned has been resolved (as we knew it would be).  I love this performance.  George Tandy is truly talented...

<abbr><em>Zenobias last blog post..<a href="http://from-the-battlefield.blogspot.com/2009/02/osf-songs-by-new-edition-or-members-of.html">OSF:  Songs by New Edition or members of New Edition</a></abbr></em>]]></wp:comment_content>

	<item>
		<title>On Being... Part 1</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/02/19/on-being-part-1/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Feb 2009 22:40:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=161</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2><strong>On Being Myself</strong></h2>
Self-discovery. Independent. Stubborn.
Good friends. Good conversation. Good times.
Good books. Good food. Good movies.
Laughter. Simple pleasures. Peace.
<h2><strong>On Being a Woman</strong></h2>
Challenging. Acceptance. Confident.
Sensual. Nurturing. Loving.
Feminine. Beautiful. Goddess.
Strong. Humble. Proud.
<h2><strong>On Being a Virgin</strong></h2>
Innocent. Experienced. Curious.
Concerned. Relieved. Anxious.
Impatient. Waiting. Scared.
Determined. Perseverant. Ready.

<em>To be continued…</em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="virgin"><![CDATA[virgin]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="woman"><![CDATA[woman]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>On Being... Part 2</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/02/22/on-being-part-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Feb 2009 22:41:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=165</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>On Being Afraid</h2>
Panic. Tears. Breathless.
Heart Racing. Head Spinning. Timeless.
Running Away. Standing Still. Helpless.
<h2>On Being Grateful</h2>
Joyful. Excited. Thankful.
Thoughtful. Encouraging. Loving.
Gracious. Compassionate. Appreciation.
<h2>On Being in Love</h2>
Friendship. Crush. Attraction.
Trust. Passion. Satisfaction.
Soulmate. Lover. Companion.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>165</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2009-02-22 18:41:26]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2009-02-22 22:41:26]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[on-being-part-2]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Unconditional Love</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/02/26/unconditional-love/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Feb 2009 14:56:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=169</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I’ve been thinking a lot lately about unconditional love. I’ve come to realize that I can only love others unconditionally if I first love myself in that way.  When you think about it, does it not make sense?

Imagine trying to accept others for who they are while being highly critical and judgmental of yourself…

Imagine trying to be compassionate with others while beating yourself up every time you make a mistake…

Imagine trying to forgive others while never forgiving yourself…

Difficult isn’t it?

So with that, I also started thinking about what unconditional love means to me – like how I would define it based on my experiences. Here’s my take:

Unconditional love is love in its highest and purest form, where there is no fear, no judgment and no unrealistic expectations
This kind of love heals and uplifts
This kind of love is given freely, even when it’s not deserved
This kind of love surpasses all understanding
This kind of love never fails

I wonder what the world would be like if everyone loved like this… Would that leave room for breakups? Maybe it does… Since as humans we are constantly growing and evolving, maybe it’s possible for 2 people to deeply love each other and yet grow apart. I imagine they would amicably part ways while having deep appreciation and gratitude for the moments shared.

Heck, I imagine that this can also apply to other types of relationships as well.  To be able to have differing opinions on things and simply agree to disagree with no hard feelings… Hmm, what a concept…

I imagine in a world where people loved like this there would be no need for wars. Countries would celebrate each other’s differences and have peaceful exchanges between each other. Poverty would most likely not exist. Governments, loving their peoples unconditionally, would see to it that all resources are fairly distributed and that all needs are met.

Taking it to the next level, I also imagine that people who love unconditionally would take greater responsibility for their environment. I don’t believe it would be necessary for all people to become vegans (though that would be great for the animals – one less predator to worry about), but I imagine that people would treat animals and the earth with more respect.  Even in nature, I believe animals are born knowing that they are either predators or preys.  Yet, I imagine there exist a certain level of respect between the animals. It’s like an unspoken understanding that it’s not personal, only survival.

Wow, in all my imaginings, I forgot that I have to get to work. My bosses have been extremely awesome to me and I have every determination to keep reciprocating the same level of awesomeness back to them.

Anyhow, this been my take on unconditional love. Anyone care to join me in putting this into practice? :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A Public Announcement to My Sick Friends and Fam</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/03/26/a-public-announcement-to-my-sick-friends-and-fam/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Mar 2009 21:10:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/2009/03/26/a-public-announcement-to-my-sick-friends-and-fam/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Dear Friends and Fam,

As many of you may know, I'm a firm believer that incorporating lot's of fresh fruits and veggies in your diet will keep your immune system strong. Sadly many times we either don't eat enough of these healing foods or our immune systems still need a little extra boost. In cases like this, the following steps usually work for me. The steps regarding the vitamins are also useful before getting sick if implemented when there's a bug going around.
<ol>
	<li>I always keep a supply of the dynamic trio - Zinc, Echinacea and Vitamin C. I take these three in addition to a multivitamin once a day until the cold or flu goes away. I also always take these three with the soup mentioned in the next step.The minute I start to feel under the weather, I either make or buy some Veggie soup without noodles or pasteurized dairy or MSG. I do add some spices and make sure it has enough natural sodium from sea salt to make the soup act as saline solution to help loosen up phlegm. As for wheat and pasteurized dairy products, I find that they can causes excessive mucous (sorry if this is TMI). MSG (Monosodium Glutamate) can cause reactions known as MSG symptom complex  which include headaches, facial pressure, numbness etc. For more information on this, visit - <a title="MSG Symptom Complex - Chinese Restaurant Syndrome" href="http://www.medicineonline.com/articles/M/2/MSG-Symptom-Complex/Chinese-Restaurant-Syndrome.html" target="_blank">MSG Symptom Complex - Chinese Restaurant Syndrome</a>. No one needs those complication when trying to heal from a cold/flu.</li>
	<li>Before drinking/serving the soup, I like to crush fresh garlic into it. Garlic is a powerful natural antibiotic and antioxidant and works wonders for me.  I've also become a fan of organic turmeric which has natural anti-inflammatory and antibiotic properties. Be sure to pair it with black or white pepper since it helps with absorption.</li>
	<li>For sore throat, I like to gargle with warm sea salt water in addition to the steps above.</li>
	<li>For both colds and flus, rest and plenty of fluids are a definite requirement.</li>
</ol>
With these steps together, I am usually able to knock out a cold within a matter of a few days and have also had success with the flu. Please keep in mind that these are steps that work for me. Everyone is different so please take that into consideration should you decide to try out these steps for yourself. For example, if you're allergic to garlic, then use wisdom and skip it and try only turmeric.

To your health and mine ;).]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[magazine-spread-2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Book Cover for A Journey of Clarity - Print, Graphic Design</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/projects/book-cover-for-a-journey-of-clarity/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Feb 2015 17:19:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=projects&#038;p=317</guid>
		<description></description>

	<item>
		<title>Everything happens for a reason...</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/2015/02/18/everything-happens-for-a-reason/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Feb 2015 18:26:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?p=577</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's been a long time since I've blogged from my <a title="Natasha's World - Check it out ;)" href="http://natashasworld.com">website</a>. I've been so busy with life and comfortable with my job that I completely abandoned it, along with my portfolio. Well, there's nothing like getting laid off to help get me back on track.

For those of you who may not have known, I worked at Citrix for almost 4.5 years. I can honestly say that it was one of the best companies I've ever worked for. Unfortunately, life or Divinity had other plans for me for 2015. Before I could reach the 5 year mark, I ended up being one of the 700 full-time employees that was laid off on February 4, 2014.

"Everything happens for a reason" is a phrase that I've heard quite a few times since that fateful day. At first it annoyed me, but then I started to see the truth in it. For one thing, this layoff gave me the motivation I needed to take down the maintenance page that had been on my site for almost 6 years. It also freed up my time so that I can both give the site a much needed facelift and update my portfolio that looked like something out of the 90's. I'm even finding myself wanting to get back into art again...

In addition to everything already mentioned, here are three lessons that I learned from all of this:

<strong>Lesson 1: Don't allow yourself to be too comfortable with a corporate job</strong>

It's easy to become very comfortable with a corporate job after you've been at a company for many years. Before you know it, you become lazy and complacent. You forget that at the end of a day, you're a replaceable employee. Unless you're the CEO or a board member with a high amount of shares, you can easily be replaced. So, stay sharp. Keep up with the latest best practices and trends in your field. Keep your resume and/or portfolio updated. Learn from my mistake. Don't wait until you're unemployed to try to figure this all out.

<strong>Lesson 2: Maintain good relationships with peers both inside and outside of your place of employment</strong>

Maintaining good working/professional relationships is very important. You never know when you'll need to connect with someone in your field for reference or recommendation. Even if you don't like someone's personality, try to find some common ground or something about him/her that you appreciate. Trust me when I say that often times, the ones you least expect are the ones that end up helping you in the future.

<strong>Lesson 3: Maintain good relationships with recruiters</strong>

No matter how much you love working at a company or how long you've been there, it doesn't hurt to have good relationships with recruiters in your area. Even if you have no plans of ever leaving, you never know when you may not have a choice. So, it makes sense to keep in touch with recruiters so that you have people to reach out to in case the inevitable happens. Good recruiters will work hard on your behalf. Trust me when I tell you that this is very helpful, especially when you're forced back into the job market after years of employment.

Anyhow, that's all I have for now. Time to move forward. My prayer is that all of us who were impacted by the layoff will find career opportunities that are perfectly suited for us. With that said, do you know anyone who's looking for a UI/Front-End Web Developer in the South Florida area and who doesn't mind some singing/humming every once in a while, occasional conversations about nutrition and a weird sense of humor? If so, let me know. Thanks. ;)

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Glance International - UI/Front-End Development, Web Design</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/projects/glance-international/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Feb 2015 22:15:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=projects&#038;p=360</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I designed and developed <strong><a href="http://www.glance-international.com/" target="_blank">Glance International's website/blog</a></strong>. This was a virtual Modeling Agency in Second Life.

[caption id="attachment_780" align="alignnone" width="749"]<a href="http://www.glance-international.com/http://"><img class="size-full wp-image-780" src="http://natashasworld.com/journal/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/details-glance-1.jpg" alt="Glance International" width="749" height="1830" /></a> Glance International[/caption]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>360</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-02-12 17:15:52]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-02-12 22:15:52]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<title>Paper Cloud - UI/Front-End Development</title>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>A Kids&#039; Brain Tumor Cure – UI/Front-End Development</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/projects/a-kids-brain-tumor-cure/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Feb 2015 03:57:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=projects&#038;p=458</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As part of the Citrix Corporate Citizenship Global Brainstorm Project winning team, I volunteered my Front-end Development skills to help rebuild the website for <strong><a href="http://akidsbraintumorcure.org/">A Kids' Brain Tumor Cure PLGA Foundation</a></strong>. Their entire site was re-designed by the UX Designers. I then coded and led process of migrating their site to WordPress. It has since been maintained by other developers, but the foundation of the work our team did is still there. You can view the website <strong><a title="A Kids' Brain Tumor Cure" href="http://akidsbraintumorcure.org/" target="_blank">here </a></strong>.

[caption id="attachment_749" align="alignnone" width="750"]<a href="http://akidsbraintumorcure.org/"><img class="wp-image-749 size-full" src="http://natashasworld.com/journal/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Detail_PLGA-1.png" alt="PLGA - A Kids’ Brain Tumor Cure" width="750" height="1925" /></a> PLGA - A Kids’ Brain Tumor Cure[/caption]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>458</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-02-13 22:57:32]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-02-14 03:57:32]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[a-kids-brain-tumor-cure]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>3</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[projects]]></wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>First Sunset - Painting</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/projects/first-sunset-painting/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 14 Feb 2015 06:56:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=projects&#038;p=463</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Medium: Acrylic
Painted in 1992


This piece is the very 1st acrylic painting I've ever done. It was from a beautiful sunset image I found in a magazine. There was a silhouette of a couple in it, but I just wanted to enjoy the scenary.

<img src="http://natashasworld.com/journal/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/painting-first-sunset.jpg" alt="First Sunset" width="750" height="962" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-465" />]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Uniform Advantage - UI/Front-End Development</title>

		<title>Contact form 1</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=wpcf7_contact_form&#038;p=280</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Feb 2015 14:26:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=wpcf7_contact_form&#038;p=280</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Your Name (required)<br />
    [text* your-name] </p>

<p>Your Email (required)<br />
    [email* your-email] </p>

<p>Subject<br />
    [text your-subject] </p>

<p>Your Message<br />
    [textarea your-message] </p>

<p>[submit "Send"]</p>
[your-subject]
[your-name] <webqueen@natashasworld.com>
From: [your-name] <[your-email]>
Subject: [your-subject]

Message Body:
[your-message]

	<item>
		<title>Contact Me</title>
		<link>http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=wpcf7_contact_form&#038;p=281</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Feb 2015 14:32:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[natashapl]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://natashasworld.com/journal/?post_type=wpcf7_contact_form&#038;p=281</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="contactFormWrapper">
<p class="small">* Required</p>
<p>[text* Name 90/80 akismet:author placeholder "Name*"]</p>
<p>[email* Email 90/80 akismet:author_email placeholder "Email*"]</p>
<p>[text Subject 90/80 placeholder "Subject"]</p>
[textarea* Message 65x6 placeholder "Message*"]
<p class="submitButton">[submit "Send"]</p>
</div>
[Subject]
[Name] <webqueen@natashasworld.com>
From: [Name] <[Email]>
Subject: [Subject]

Message Body:
[Message]

--
This e-mail was sent from a contact form on Natasha&#039;s World (http://natashasworld.com/journal)
webqueen@natashasworld.com
Reply-To: [Email]




[your-subject]
Natasha's World <webqueen@natashasworld.com>
Message Body:
[your-message]

--
This e-mail was sent from a contact form on Natasha&#039;s World (http://natashasworld.com/journal)
[your-email]
Reply-To: webqueen@natashasworld.com

I am thankful for the guidance she has given me in these areas and am so glad to see her finally sharing her wealth of knowledge with so many others that seek it.]]></content:encoded>
